{{Wired embedded system |brand=SolidRun |model=ClearFog |revision=Pro (Rev 2.1) |price=170 |est_release_date=11/2015 |manuf_country=Israel |is_manuf=Yes |type=single-board computer, router |pwr_v=9-32 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner=2.1 |pwr_barrel_len=9.5 |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88F6828 |cpu1_cspeed=1.6 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=0 |ram1=1 GiB |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe, USB 3.0, M.2, SFP, MikroBus |expansion_minipcie_num=2 |expansion_usb_num=1 |expansion_sata_num=1 |expansion_sfp_num=1 |jtag=yes,, 20-pin header,, populated,, CON4 |serial=yes,, USB Female Micro-B,, (115200 8N1) |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Marvell |eth_chip2_model=88E1512 |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model=88E6176 |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=6 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=USB to Basic UART IC;FTDI;FT230X;;1;,,, 16-Channel LED Driver;NXP;PCA9855;;1;,,, 3A, 36V Synchronous Step-Down Converter;Richtek;RT2875B;;2;,,, 1A Low-Dropout Positive Voltage Regulator;On Semi;NCP1117;;1;,,, Low-Power 10-bit A/D Converter w/ I2C Interface;Microchip;MCP3021;;1; |flags=RTC w/ battery backup, MicroSD Card slot, Micro SIM Card slot, metal case, PoE Expansion header, heatsink |stock_boot=U-Boot;2017.07; |stock_os=Linux;4.9.45;Debian 9 Stretch; |tp_firmware=Armbian, Arch Linux (Arm), OpenWrt |oui_eth=EA:A9:B3 }} {{TagLine|Open Development Kit SBC Tailor Made for Fog Computing}} :[https://developer.solid-run.com/products/clearfog-pro/ Product page] {{â€¢}} [https://developer.solid-run.com/article-categories/clearfog/ Support]
"SolidRun ClearFog-A1 Rev-2.1" is silkscreened on the board top.

*[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SolidRun#ClearFog ''SolidRun -> ClearFog'' on '''Wikipedia'''] *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2015/11/09/solidrun-clearfog-pro-and-base-router-boards-feature-marvell-armada-380388-processor/ ''SolidRun ClearFog Pro and Base Router Boards <!--Feature Marvell ARMADA 380/388 Processor-->'' on '''CNX|Soft''' ] *[http://linuxgizmos.com/sbc-packs-six-port-gbe-switch-runs-linux-on-armada-38x-soc/ ''SBC packs six-port GbE switch, runs Linux on Armada 38x'' on '''LinuxGizmos''']
